info.title: ORCID Link Service
info.description:
The *ORCID Link Service* provides an API to enable the linking of a KBase
 user account to an ORCID account. This "link" consists of a [Link Record](#user-content-header_type_linkrecord) which 
 contains a KBase username, ORCID id, ORCID access token, and a few other fields. This link record allows
 KBase to create tools and services which utilize the ORCID api to view or modify
 certain aspects of a users ORCID profile.

Once connected, *ORCID Link* enables certain integrations, including:

- syncing your KBase profile from your ORCID profile
- creating and managing KBase public Narratives within your ORCID profile

contact.name: KBase, Lawrence Berkeley National Laboratory, DOE

get.description:
Get Service Status

With no parameters, this endpoint returns the current status of the service. The status code itself
is always "ok". Other information includes the current time, and the start time.

It can be used as a healthcheck, for basic latency performance (as it makes no
i/o or other high-latency calls), or for time synchronization (as it returns the current time).

Get Service Information

Returns basic information about the service and its runtime configuration.

Get ORCID Link

Return the link for the user associated with the KBase auth token passed in
the "Authorization" header

200.description: Returns the Public link record for this user; contains no secrets

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

404.description: Link not available for this user

delete.description:
Delete ORCID Link

Removes the link for the user associated with the KBase auth token passed in the "Authorization" header

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

404.description: Link not available for this user

get.description:
Get whether Is Linked

Determine if the user associated with the KBase auth token in the "Authorization" header has a
link to an ORCID account.

200.description: Returns a boolean indicating whether the user account is linked to ORCID

schema.title: Response 200 Is Linked Link Is Linked Get

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

get.description:
Get whether Is Linked

Determine if the user associated with the KBase auth token in the "Authorization" header has a
link to an ORCID account.

200.description: Returns the shared portion of an ORCID Link record

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

post.description:
Create Linking Session

Creates a new "linking session"; resulting in a linking session created in the database,
and the id for it returned for usage in an interactive linking session.

201.description: The linking session has been successfully created

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

get.description:
Get Linking Session

Returns the linking session record identified by the given linking session id,
as long as it is owned by the user associated with the given KBase auth token.

Note that the

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

403.description: User does not own linking session

delete.description:
Delete Linking Session

Deletes the linking session record associated with the session id provided
in the url, as long as it is owned by the user associated with the provided
KBase auth token.

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

403.description: Username does not match linking session

put.description:
Finish Linking Session

The final stage of the interactive linking session; called when the user confirms the creation
of the link, after OAuth flow has finished.

200.description: The linking session has been finished successfully

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

403.description: Username does not match linking session

get.description:
Start Linking Session

This endpoint is designed to be used directly by the browser. It is the "start"
of the ORCID OAuth flow. If the provided session id is found and the associated
session record is still in the initial state, it will initiate the OAuth flow
by redirecting the browser to an endpoint at ORCID.

Starts a "linking session", an interactive OAuth flow the end result of which is an access_token stored at
KBase for future use by the user.

parameters.name: return_link

schema.description: A url to redirect to after the entire linking is complete; not to be confused with the ORCID OAuth flow's redirect_url
schema.title: Return Link

parameters.description: A url to redirect to after the entire linking is complete; not to be confused with the ORCID OAuth flow's redirect_url

parameters.name: skip_prompt

schema.description: Whether to prompt for confirmation of linking
schema.title: Skip Prompt

parameters.description: Whether to prompt for confirmation of linking

parameters.name: kbase_session

schema.description: KBase auth token taken from a cookie named 'kbase_session'
schema.title: Kbase Session

parameters.description: KBase auth token taken from a cookie named 'kbase_session'

parameters.name: kbase_session_backup

schema.description: KBase auth token taken from a cookie named 'kbase_session_backup. Required in the KBase production environment since the prod ui and services operate on different hosts; the primary cookie, kbase_session, is host-based so cannot be read by a prod service.
schema.title: Kbase Session Backup

parameters.description: KBase auth token taken from a cookie named 'kbase_session_backup. Required in the KBase production environment since the prod ui and services operate on different hosts; the primary cookie, kbase_session, is host-based so cannot be read by a prod service.

302.description: Redirect to ORCID if a valid linking session

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

404.description: Response when a linking session not found for the supplied session id

get.description:
Continue Linking Session

This endpoint implements the end point for the ORCID OAuth flow. That is, it
serves as the redirection target after the user has successfully completed
their interaction with ORCID, at which they may have logged in and provided
their consent to issuing the linking token to KBase.

Note that since this is an "interactive" endpoint, which does not have its own
user interface, rather redirects to kbase-ui when finished. This applies to
errors as well. Errors are displayed by redirecting the browser to an endpoint
in kbase-ui which is designed to expect the error values for display to be
in the url itself.

parameters.name: code

schema.description: For a success case, contains an OAuth exchange code parameter
schema.title: Code

parameters.description: For a success case, contains an OAuth exchange code parameter

parameters.name: state

schema.description: For a success case, contains an OAuth state parameter
schema.title: State

parameters.description: For a success case, contains an OAuth state parameter

parameters.name: error

schema.description: For an error case, contains an error code parameter
schema.title: Error

parameters.description: For an error case, contains an error code parameter

parameters.name: kbase_session

schema.description: KBase auth token taken from a cookie named 'kbase_session'
schema.title: Kbase Session

parameters.description: KBase auth token taken from a cookie named 'kbase_session'

parameters.name: kbase_session_backup

schema.description: KBase auth token taken from a cookie named 'kbase_session_backup. Required in the KBase production environment since the prod ui and services operate on different hosts; the primary cookie, kbase_session, is host-based so cannot be read by a prod service.
schema.title: Kbase Session Backup

parameters.description: KBase auth token taken from a cookie named 'kbase_session_backup. Required in the KBase production environment since the prod ui and services operate on different hosts; the primary cookie, kbase_session, is host-based so cannot be read by a prod service.

302.description: Redirect to the continuation page; or error page

401.description: Linking requires authorization; same meaning as standard auth 401, but caught and issued in a different manner

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

get.description:
Get the ORCID profile for the user associated with the current auth token.

Since ORCID Link is not a general purpose ORCID api, we may not fully
represent the profile as ORCID does, but modify it for purpose.
E.g. ORCID work records have a lot of optional fields which we
actually require. This is reflected in the typing. So we can't really
provide all work records in the profile, just those created by
KBase.

Returns a 404 Not Found if the user is not linked

404.description: User not linked or ORCID profile not available.

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

get.description: Fetch the work record, identified by `put_code`, for the user associated with the KBase auth token provided in the `Authorization` header

parameters.name: put_code

schema.description: The ORCID `put code` for the work record to fetch
schema.title: Put Code

parameters.description: The ORCID `put code` for the work record to fetch

404.description: Link not available for this user

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

401.description: KBase auth token absent or invalid

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

schema.title: Response 200 Get Works Orcid Works Get

422.description: Input or output data does not comply with the API schema

get.description:
Get API Documentation

Provides a web interface to the auto-generated API docs.

role.title: Role
role.description: The role performed by the collaborator or other contributor.
kbNotes: Interestingly this is called contributor-attributes in the orcid xsd
The role itself is stored as a structure with a sequence (index) and the role itself.
Note that this the available values consist of old and new ones.
The new ones are all from credit.niso.org.
Both are supported in their UI, but we should only support the new ones.
role.kbSourceType: work:contributor -> sequence of -> contributor-attributes -> work:contributor-attributes -> sequence of -> contributor-role -> common:contributor-role

code.title: Code
code.description: A unique code associated with this specific type of error

title.title: Title
title.description: A human-readable title for this error; displayable as an error dialog title

message.title: Message
message.description: A human-readable error message, meant to be displayed to an end user or developer

ErrorResponse.title: ErrorResponse
ErrorResponse.description:
A generic error object used for all error responses.

    See [the error docs](docs/errors.md) for more information.

type.title: External Id Type
type.description: The type of an external identifier
kbNotes: Supported external-id-type values can be found at https://pub.orcid.org/v2.0/identifiers
Note that the above is an html table, although the page is simple, unstyled.
From common.xsd: Must contain one or more charaters that are not a space, carriage return or linefeed
Uses this regex as a rule to ensure this:

value.title: External Id Value
value.description: The value of an external identifier
kbNotes: Same generic 'non-empty-string' as above.

url.title: External Id URL
kbNotes: See notes for other usages of anyURL

relationship.title: External Id Relationship
kbNotes: Available values are located in common.xsd itself!
along with a reference to a java class that applies 'other rules'see source ref url below

title.title: Title
title.description: The main name or title of the work.

date.title: Date
date.kbComment: should probably rename to publication date; too ambiguous now, if simpler.
kbNotes: Note that it is 'fuzzy' because it can be year, year/month, year/month/day
Thus cannot be converted to a date, except in the year/month/day form
date.kbSourceName: work -> publication-date -> fuzzy-date, with subfields for date parts

workType.title: Work Type
workType.description: The type of object that the work is, from a list of available types
kbNotes: unfortunately although the linked docs note that there is an api resource providing
the list of types, that url redirects to a documentation page, which includes
that information splayed out into a table.

url.title: URL
kbNotes: from common.xsd: Represents a URL in the XML anyURI format
weird, it looks like there are to entries for url in common.xsd.
the upstream type is very broad, can include relative URLs,
IRIs (International RIs), etc.

doi.title: DOI
doi.description: The Digitial Object Identifier (DOI) assigned to the Narrative
doi.kbComment: This is stored, ultimately, with the externalIds, but separated for simplification.

journal.title: Journal
journal.description: The title of the publication or group under which the work was published.
journal.kbComment: This is an ORCID 'non-empty-string' with a cap of 1000 characters applied

shortDescription.title: Short Description
shortDescription.description: A short narrative (few sentences) describing the item.
shortDescription.kbComment: This is an ORCID 'non-empty-string' with a cap of 5000 characters applied

selfContributor.title: Self Contributor
selfContributor.description: The contribution container for the owner of this work record.
kbNotes: We have separated out the selfContributor in this structure to simplify
implementation and apply different rules. E.g. the self contributor must
have an ORCID Id (by definition!)
Also note that this, like other fields that extend 'element-summary' gets a bunch
of fields for free that we ignore - created, modified, source, put-code.
ORCID itself will ignore many of these fields like put-code, and some are clearly
only relevant for reading records from ORCID.
selfContributor.kbSourceType: work:work -> extends common:element-summary -> contributors -> work:contributors -> contributor -> work:contributor

otherContributors.title: Other Contributors
otherContributors.description: Container for the contributors of a Work.
otherContributors.kbSourceType: work:work -> extends common:element-summary -> contributors -> work:contributors -> contributor -> work:contributor

NewWork.title: NewWork
NewWork.description: Represents a work record that is going to be added to ORCID.

type.title: Type
kbNotes: The available values are cited in work.xsd itself

value.title: Value
kbNotes: A simple string with no constraints
You would think it would be constrained to something large just for sanity

orcidId.title: ORCID Id
orcidId.description: ORCID iD for the contributor - only add if you have collected an authenticated iD for the contributor
kbNotes: Although we simplify to just the orcid id string, at ORCID it is implemented
as a more complex object. I won't explain that, just follow the link below to
see it in all it's glory...

name.title: Name
name.description: The name to use for the researcher or contributor when credited or cited
kbNotes: a string of maximum length 150.
name.kbSourceType: work:contributor -> sequence of -> credit-name -> common:credit-name -> common:string-150

roles.title: Roles
kbNotes: Interestingly this is called contributor-attributes in the orcid xsd
The role itself is stored as a structure with a sequence (index) and the role itself.
Note that this the available values consist of old and new ones.
The new ones are all from credit.niso.org.
Both are supported in their UI, but we should only support the new ones.
roles.kbSourceType: work:contributor -> sequence of -> contributor-attributes -> work:contributor-attributes -> sequence of -> contributor-role -> common:contributor-role

ORCIDContributor.title: ORCIDContributor
ORCIDContributor.description:
Note that the orcidId is not required for the "regular" contributor.
    The "self contributor" described below, does, require it.

orcidId.title: ORCID Id
orcidId.description: ORCID iD for the contributor - only add if you have collected an authenticated iD for the contributor
kbNotes: Although we simplify to just the orcid id string, at ORCID it is implemented
as a more complex object. I won't explain that, just follow the link below to
see it in all it's glory...

name.title: Name
name.description: The name to use for the researcher or contributor when credited or cited
kbNotes: a string of maximum length 150.
name.kbSourceType: work:contributor -> sequence of -> credit-name -> common:credit-name -> common:string-150

roles.title: Roles
kbNotes: Interestingly this is called contributor-attributes in the orcid xsd
The role itself is stored as a structure with a sequence (index) and the role itself.
Note that this the available values consist of old and new ones.
The new ones are all from credit.niso.org.
Both are supported in their UI, but we should only support the new ones.
roles.kbSourceType: work:contributor -> sequence of -> contributor-attributes -> work:contributor-attributes -> sequence of -> contributor-role -> common:contributor-role

putCode.title: Put Code
putCode.description: Uniquely identifies a work record for a given user; required when updating or deleting a work record.
putCode.kbComment: Note no upstream constraints, just integer

createdAt.title: Created At
createdAt.description: Moment in time at which the work record was created; in epoch milliseconds.
createdAt.kbComments: Defined ultimately in the XSD datatypes documentation; Source: created-date.value; xs:dateTime; generally not required in upstream

updatedAt.title: Updated At
updatedAt.description: Moment in time at which the work record was updated; in epoch milliseconds.
updatedAt.kbComments: Defined ultimately in the XSD datatypes documentation; Source: created-date.value; xs:dateTime; generally not required in upstream

source.title: Source
source.description: Internal (generated by ORCID) field representing which entity created the work record. KBase has it's own code for CI (and in the future, prod).
source.kbComments: Since we now only use work activity records created by KBase, we can probably drop this field.

title.title: Title
title.description: The main name or title of the work.

date.title: Date
date.kbComment: should probably rename to publication date; too ambiguous now, if simpler.
kbNotes: Note that it is 'fuzzy' because it can be year, year/month, year/month/day
Thus cannot be converted to a date, except in the year/month/day form
date.kbSourceName: work -> publication-date -> fuzzy-date, with subfields for date parts

WorkUpdate.title: WorkUpdate
WorkUpdate.description:
Represents a work record which has been fetched from ORCID, modified,
    and can be sent back to update the ORCID work record

tags.name: link
tags.description: Access to and control over stored ORCID Links

tags.name: linking-sessions
tags.description:
OAuth integration and internal support for creating ORCID Links.

The common path element is `/linking-sessions`.

Some of the endpoints are "browser interactive", meaning that the links are followed 
directly by the browser, rather than being used within Javascript code.

tags.name: orcid
tags.description: Direct access to ORCID via ORCID Link

tags.name: works
tags.description: Add, remove, update 'works' records for a user's ORCID Account
